summary: This is a formal letter from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the Metropolitan Correctional Center's legal department. It requests specific documents and records related to Epstein's death in custody on August 9-10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for an independent investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The client of the law firm and the subject of the document request; died in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal charges.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.context: Attorney at Steptoe & Johnson LLP who signed the letter requesting evidence related to Epstein's death on behalf of Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney from Martin G. Weinberg, P.C., also listed as counsel on the letter requesting evidence related to Epstein's death.

persons.name: William P. Barr
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney General who made public statements indicating Epstein's death raised serious questions and that serious irregularities at the facility demanded a thorough investigation.

connections.description: Miller, as an attorney at Steptoe & Johnson, is representing Epstein's estate in requesting documents related to his death.
Weinberg is listed as counsel on the letter, indicating representation of Epstein's estate.
As Attorney General, Barr publicly commented on the serious questions and irregularities surrounding Epstein's death in federal custody.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was pronounced dead after being transported to a hospital.

events.title: Period of Investigation Request
events.description: The time period for which Epstein's attorneys are requesting evidence (video, logs, protocols) from the MCC, spanning from 7:00 a.m. on August 9 to 8:00 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Barr's Statement on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William Barr stated that "serious irregularities" at the MCC facility had been learned, which were deeply concerning and demanded a thorough investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by an apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial.
Epstein's attorneys, acting on behalf of his estate, are formally requesting specific evidence from the MCC for the period surrounding his death, citing "serious irregularities" at the facility.
Attorney General William Barr publicly stated that Epstein's death raised serious questions and that serious irregularities at the MCC demanded a thorough investigation.
The FBI was investigating the incident at the time of this letter.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially declined to immediately release a determination on the cause and manner of death, citing a need for further information.
